docs.text: Overview Flowlint was created as part of an internal Cisco project to be used to do basic linting on Cisco SecureX Orchestrator workflows. It can be used to check various rules against these workflows. It was created using Spectral Lint and can be extended easily as such. Each workflow rule was learned over time and thus we wish to pass this learned information on to others. Getting Started Installation Flowlint is a fully dockerized linter that can be used within the docker container in various CI pipelines or locally. It was designed in pure javascript and also can therefore be run in a browser. To install flowlint, simply download the docker container as shown: Install Only docker pull docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:${VERSION} Where ${VERSION} is the version you would like to use. See Flowlint Packages for a list of available Flowlint versions. Install & Run docker run -it -v ${PATH_TO_WORKFLOW_JSON}:/workflow.json docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:${VERSION} /workflow.json Where ${VERSION} is the version you would like to use. See Flowlint Packages for a list of available Flowlint versions. and ${PATH_TO_WORKFLOW_JSON} is the filepath to the workflow.json file you would like to lint. Example docker pull docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:1.0.0 Usage To lint a workflow, simply use the following command: docker run -it -v ${PATH_TO_WORKFLOW_JSON}:/workflow.json docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:1.0.0 /workflow.json Where ${PATH_TO_WORKFLOW_JSON} is the filepath to the workflow.json file you would like to lint. Example docker run -it -v my_workflow.json:/workflow.json docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:1.0.0 /workflow.json
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: Flowlint was created as part of an internal Cisco project to be used to do basic linting on Cisco SecureX Orchestrator workflows. It can be used to check various rules against these workflows. It was created using Spectral Lint and can be extended easily as such. Each workflow rule was learned over time and thus we wish to pass this learned information on to others.
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: Flowlint is a fully dockerized linter that can be used within the docker container in various CI pipelines or locally. It was designed in pure javascript and also can therefore be run in a browser. To install flowlint, simply download the docker container as shown: Install Only docker pull docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:${VERSION} Where ${VERSION} is the version you would like to use. See Flowlint Packages for a list of available Flowlint versions. Install & Run docker run -it -v ${PATH_TO_WORKFLOW_JSON}:/workflow.json docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:${VERSION} /workflow.json Where ${VERSION} is the version you would like to use. See Flowlint Packages for a list of available Flowlint versions. and ${PATH_TO_WORKFLOW_JSON} is the filepath to the workflow.json file you would like to lint. Example docker pull docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:1.0.0
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: To lint a workflow, simply use the following command: docker run -it -v ${PATH_TO_WORKFLOW_JSON}:/workflow.json docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:1.0.0 /workflow.json Where ${PATH_TO_WORKFLOW_JSON} is the filepath to the workflow.json file you would like to lint. Example docker run -it -v my_workflow.json:/workflow.json docker.pkg.github.com/ciscoaandi/flowlint/flowlint:1.0.0 /workflow.json

docs.text: Cleanup Workflow Severity: Description Be careful when you select this "Clean up after successful execution" as it will delete the action's logs and they cannot be used to debug your workflow. Error Message If you check "Clean up after successful execution", your workflow or atomic action's instances will be deleted if they're successful. This means you won't be able to view them for debugging purposes. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Cleanup-Workflow Rule Definition field: delete_workflow_instance function: falsy

docs.text: Http Continue On Failure Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message In most cases, you probably want "Continue on HTTP error status code" instead. If you're using this option intentionally, make sure you're using a Condition Block to handle failures. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Http-Continue-On-Failure Rule Definition field: properties.continue_on_failure function: falsy

docs.text: Jsonpath Continue On Failure Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message If the JSON path query you look for isn't found, the activity will fail and your workflow will fail with it. If you want to avoid this, you can check continue on failure and use a Condition Block to check if the path query was successful. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Jsonpath-Continue-On-Failure Rule Definition field: properties.continue_on_failure function: truthy

docs.text: No Global Variables Severity: Description Global variables should not be used so that when the workflows are shared across SecureX tenants, errors are not encountered during the import. Error Message Global variables should not be used in workflows or atomic actions meant to be shared. Instead, use a "Set Variables" activity to copy global variables to local variables within the workflow. Before exporting, simply remove the global variables so the other user can select their own. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/No-Global-Variables Rule Definition field: variables function: length functionOptions: max: 0
docs.title: No Global Variables

docs.title: No Global Variables

docs.text: No Subworkflows Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message We do not recommend using subworkflows as they complicate the import/export process. You may want to consider using some atomic actions instead depending on what your subworkflow does. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/No-Subworkflows Rule Definition field: type function: pattern functionOptions: notMatch: ^workflow\.sub_workflow$

docs.text: Required Categories Severity: Description For readability, this rule ensures that you always specify at least one category for your workflow. This makes your workflows easier to search and filter through. Error Message Every workflow needs at least 1 category. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Required-Categories/ Rule Definition - field: categories function: defined - field: categories function: length functionOptions: min: 1

docs.text: Required Description Severity: Description A description is required for every workflow so that it can be easily understood as workflows are stored in git and move around and are shared. Error Message Every workflow needs a description of length at least 10. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Required-Description Rule Definition - field: description function: defined - field: description function: length functionOptions: min: 10

docs.text: Every workflow variable needs a description of length at least 10. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Required-Variable-Description Rule Definition - field: properties.description function: defined - field: properties.description function: length functionOptions: min: 10
docs.title: Error Message

docs.text: Required Workflow Key Severity: Description Every workflow needs a key at the top level for defining the values in the workflow. Error Message Every workflow needs a high level workflow key. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Required-Workflow-Key Rule Definition field: workflow function: defined
docs.title: Required Workflow Key

docs.text: Secure Strings Have Default Values Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message If a Secure String variable has a value when exported, it will prompt the user for its value during import. If you want to avoid this, clear the Secure String's value before exporting the workflow. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Secure-Strings-Have-Default-Values Rule Definition field: properties.value function: length functionOptions: min: 1
docs.title: Secure Strings Have Default Values

docs.text: Target Account Keys Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message All atomic actions should have their account key set to "Use Target's Default Account Keys". This allows the atomic to inherit whatever account key is associated with the target provided by the parent workflow. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Account-Keys Rule Definition - field: runtime_user function: defined - field: runtime_user.target_default function: truthy
docs.title: Target Account Keys

docs.text: Target Atomic Exists Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message Not having a target is ok for an atomic action if it doesn't need to communicate with anything. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Atomic-Exists Rule Definition field: no_target function: falsy

docs.text: Target Selection Criteria Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message This is typically "Equals Case-Insensitive" but other operators are fine if you're doing something specific. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Selection-Criteria Rule Definition - function: or functionOptions: properties: - field: no_target function: truthy - function: and functionOptions: properties: - field: execute_on_target_group function: truthy - field: target_group.use_criteria function: defined - field: target_group.use_criteria.conditions function: defined - field: target_group.use_criteria.conditions function: length functionOptions: min: 1 - field: target_group.use_criteria.conditions.0.operator function: pattern functionOptions: match: ^eqi$
docs.title: Target Selection Criteria

docs.text: This is typically "Equals Case-Insensitive" but other operators are fine if you're doing something specific. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Selection-Criteria Rule Definition - function: or functionOptions: properties: - field: no_target function: truthy - function: and functionOptions: properties: - field: execute_on_target_group function: truthy - field: target_group.use_criteria function: defined - field: target_group.use_criteria.conditions function: defined - field: target_group.use_criteria.conditions function: length functionOptions: min: 1 - field: target_group.use_criteria.conditions.0.operator function: pattern functionOptions: match: ^eqi$

docs.text: Target Specify On Start Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message All atomic actions should have their target set to "Specify Target On Workflow Start". This allows the atomic to be more portable since the workflow using it can specify the target. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Specify-On-Start Rule Definition function: or functionOptions: properties: - field: no_target function: truthy - field: specify_on_workflow_start function: truthy
docs.title: Target Specify On Start

docs.text: All atomic actions should have their target set to "Specify Target On Workflow Start". This allows the atomic to be more portable since the workflow using it can specify the target. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Target-Specify-On-Start Rule Definition function: or functionOptions: properties: - field: no_target function: truthy - field: specify_on_workflow_start function: truthy

docs.text: Use Default Target Group Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message We recommend using the "Default TargetGroup" since every SecureX orchestration tenant should have it by default. If you use your own target group, it will be created during workflow import. See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Use-Default-Target-Group Rule Definition - function: or functionOptions: properties: - field: no_target function: truthy - function: and functionOptions: properties: - field: execute_on_target_group function: truthy - field: target_group.target_group_id function: defined - field: target_group.target_group_id function: pattern functionOptions: match: ^target_group_01EJ0TQWPQWBD0qiWqClJKj9FOzwiZRfOFH$
docs.title: Use Default Target Group

docs.text: Use Workflow Target Severity: Description This rule has no available description Error Message All activities in an atomic action that use a target should be set to "Use Workflow Target". See here for more details: https://CiscoAandI.github.io/flowlint/rules/Use-Workflow-Target Rule Definition field: properties.target.use_workflow_target function: truthy
